div.l: And God that sittith hy in mageste
Save al this compane grete and smale
Thus have I quyt the Myller͗e his tale
Here endith the Reve his tale
Here beginnyth the Koke his Prollog
Te koke of london̄ while þe Reve spak
For Ioy he thoght he clawid him on þe bak
Aha quod he for Cristis own̄ passioun̄
This Myller͗e hath a sharp conclucioun
Oppon his argument of herbegage
Wele seyd Salamon in his langage
Ne prese nat euery man in to thyn howse
For herburghyng be nyght is perlowse
Wele oght a man a vysid for to be
Whom that he bryng in to his pryvite
I pray to God so yeve me sorowe and care
Syn ewyr͗e that I hight hoge of ware
Herd I Myller͗e bet I set a werk
He had a Iape of malice in the derk
But God for bede þat wee styntyn here
And þerfore yf yee wowch save to here
A tale of me that am a pore man
I wol yewe tel as wel as ewir I can̄
A litil Iape that fil in our͗e Cete
Our͗e Ost answerd and seid I grᵃaunnt it the
Nowe tel on Roger͗e loke that it be good
For many a pasty hast þowe lete blode
And many a Iak of dowir͗e hast þowe sold
That hathe be twyis hote and twyis cold
Of many a pylgrym hast þowe Cristis Curs
For yit of thy persely they fare the wors
Nowe tel on gentil Roger͗e be thy name
But I prey the be nat wroth for game
A man may sey ful sothe in game and pley
Thowe seyst ful sothe seid Roger͗e be my fe
